comments.creator: csuciu@softvision.ro
comments.author: csuciu@softvision.ro
comments.text:
Build ID: Mozilla/5.0 (Android; Linux armv7l; rv:9.0a2) Gecko/20111030 Firefox/9.0a2 Fennec/9.0a2
Device: HTC Desire
OS: Android 2.2

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open Fennec app.
2. Go to Tools -> Preferences tab.
3. Under Sync area tap on Connect button.
4. Select "I'm not near my computer".
5. Enter some incorrect account name, password or recovery key.
6. Tap on Connect button.
7. Wait for the "Incorrect account name or password" message to be displayed 

Expected Result:
"Incorrect account name or password" or "Wrong sync key" message should be displayed

Actual Result:
Sync status is changed from "Connecting..." to "Not Connected" without showing any warning message.

Note: This is not reproducible on the latest Nightly(30/10).
comments.raw_text:
Build ID: Mozilla/5.0 (Android; Linux armv7l; rv:9.0a2) Gecko/20111030 Firefox/9.0a2 Fennec/9.0a2
Device: HTC Desire
OS: Android 2.2

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open Fennec app.
2. Go to Tools -> Preferences tab.
3. Under Sync area tap on Connect button.
4. Select "I'm not near my computer".
5. Enter some incorrect account name, password or recovery key.
6. Tap on Connect button.
7. Wait for the "Incorrect account name or password" message to be displayed 

Expected Result:
"Incorrect account name or password" or "Wrong sync key" message should be displayed

Actual Result:
Sync status is changed from "Connecting..." to "Not Connected" without showing any warning message.

Note: This is not reproducible on the latest Nightly(30/10).

comments.text: When did this break?  If it's not recent, I think we can wait for Fx10 to resolve this.
comments.author: mconnor@mozilla.com
